event.doc_name: Plaintiffs' Motion for a Preliminary Injunction

evidence.text: the Court should enter an order that enjoins Defendants from implementing their decision in April 2025 to terminate grants issued by the U.S. Department of Justice Office of Justice Programs
evidence.source_document: Plaintiffs' Motion for a Preliminary Injunction

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: enjoin Defendants from implementing their decision in April 2025 to terminate grants issued by the U.S. Department of Justice Office of Justice Programs

event.doc_name: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: Declare unlawful, vacate, and set aside OJP’s decision to conduct an en masse termination of the putative class members’ grants
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declare unlawful, vacate, and set aside OJP’s decision to conduct an en masse termination of the putative class members’ grants

evidence.text: Declare unlawful, vacate, set aside Defendants’ terminations of the putative class members’ grants
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declare unlawful, vacate, set aside Defendants’ terminations of the putative class members’ grants

evidence.text: Declare that OJP’s terminations violate the Fifth Amendment’s Due Process Clause
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declare that OJP’s terminations violate the Fifth Amendment’s Due Process Clause

evidence.text: Declare that OJP’s terminations violate the separation of powers, the Take Care Clause, and the Appropriations and Spending Clauses
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declare that OJP’s terminations violate the separation of powers, the Take Care Clause, and the Appropriations and Spending Clauses

evidence.text: Declare that OJP’s terminations on the basis of Section 200.340(a)(4) are unlawful, including its interpretation that 2 C.F.R. § 200.340(a)(4) allows OJP to terminate a grant based on a “change” in agency priorities
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declare that OJP’s terminations on the basis of Section 200.340(a)(4) are unlawful, including its interpretation that 2 C.F.R. § 200.340(a)(4) allows OJP to terminate a grant based on a “change” in agency priorities

evidence.text: Declare that OJP’s terminations are arbitrary, capricious, an abuse of discretion, or otherwise not in accordance with law
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declare that OJP’s terminations are arbitrary, capricious, an abuse of discretion, or otherwise not in accordance with law

evidence.text: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from enforcing, implementing, maintaining, or giving effect to the terminations of putative class members’ grants, including through the enforcement of closeout obligations
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from enforcing, implementing, maintaining, or giving effect to the terminations of putative class members’ grants, including through the enforcement of closeout obligations

evidence.text: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from re-obligating the funds used to support putative class members’ terminated grants
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from re-obligating the funds used to support putative class members’ terminated grants

evidence.text: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from terminating Plaintiffs’ grants without notice and a reasonable opportunity to object prior to deprivation of their protected interests in grant funding
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from terminating Plaintiffs’ grants without notice and a reasonable opportunity to object prior to deprivation of their protected interests in grant funding

evidence.text: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from declining to spend the funds that Congress has appropriated for OJP grants
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from declining to spend the funds that Congress has appropriated for OJP grants

evidence.text: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from terminating grants under 2 C.F.R. § 200.340(a)(4) on the basis of a “change” in agency priorities

evidence.text: Stay the termination of the grants pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 705
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Stay the termination of the grants pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 705

evidence.text: Enter judgment in favor of Plaintiffs
